data:
FF-01, Sanskriti Apartments, KH No.534-535, Extended Lal Dora, Burari, 
                                                 Delhi -110084

www.dowellresearch.com, accounts@dowellindia.com

       Offer Letter


30 June 2022

To

Mr Aminul Akram

8-4-544/7/8 Sanjay Nagar, 

Erragadda, Hyderabad-18


Hi Aminul Akram,

Sub: Letter of Offer


1. D’Well Informatics & Services Pvt. Ltd. (the “Company”) is pleased to offer you the position of “Assistant Project Manager - Operations Dept.” at FF-01, Sanskriti Apartments, KH No. 534- 535, Burari, Delhi- 110084, India. Your appointment shall commence on 1st July 2022.


2. You will directly report to the Director -Global Operations Mrs Simi Nair  at all times and you will serve this position at the pleasure of the Company. Your service in this capacity is subject to an annual review and reappointment in accordance with the Company policies and applicable law.

3. In this position, you will be eligible to receive the company's benefits. If you have any benefits’ related questions, do not hesitate to contact the Human Resources Department of the Company.

 

4. You will be paid gross emoluments as detailed in Annexure-A and your employment with the Company will be governed by the terms & conditions as detailed in Annexure -B.


5. Your employment is subject to the laws of the State of Delhi; the availability of funds, policies and regulations of the Board of Directors and the Company.


6. You will be on training for an initial period of three (3) months and on probation for a period of six (6) months from the date of commencement of training. On successful completion of your training and based on the availability of a position, your transition from trainee to probationary will be made on the basis of your appraisal at the end of the period of training.


7. You shall not be allowed to work in any other organisation, be a freelancer or conduct any type of business during the training, probation and employment period without the permission of the management. 


8. This offer of employment does not imply any commitment to your continued employment and supersedes any other agreements, written or oral, with regard to your employment with the Company.


9. Your offer has been made based on the Information furnished by you. However, if there is any discrepancy in the copies of documents or certificates provided by you; the Company retains the right to review this offer of employment.

10. Employment as per this offer is subject to you being medically fit.


11. Please sign and return the dated copy of this letter to indicate your acceptance, along with the copy of your photo ID proof not later than two (2) days. 


The terms and conditions in this letter and the Annexures are based on the Company’s policy, procedures and other rules applicable in India and are subject to amendments and adjustments from time to time. All matters including those not specifically covered such as travelling, retirement, etc. shall be governed by the rules of the Company as shall be in force or are framed from time to time.


The Company welcomes you and looks forward to your contribution to the growth of the Company and yourself.

For D`well Informatics & Services Pvt. Ltd.
Authorised Signatory

Annexure– A


  1. Salary structures shall be bifurcated as under

Basic Pay

Rs.12857/-  per Month

Cost of Living Allowance (COLA)

Nil

House Rent Allowances (40% of Basic Pay)

Rs.5143/-  per month

Medical Allowances

Based on Insurance

Conveyance Allowances

Actuals for Duty

Production Bonus 

10% of Basic pay (Minimum)

Other Allowances

Based on Performance

Total

Rs.18000/-  per month

Deductions


Professional Tax 

Based on Applicable laws

Leave Salary

Based on Rules of the Company

P.F.

Based on PF Rules

TDS

Based on IT Rules

Others

Nil


  1. Retirals 

  1. You will participate in the Company Provident Fund Scheme as applicable to your category of employees.


  1. You will be entitled to gratuity in accordance with the rules governing such payment.


  1. Salary Revision

Your salary will be reviewed on January 1st of each year, or at such other time as the Management may decide. Salary revisions are discretionary and will be subject to, and made on the basis of, effective performance and results.


4. Insurance Policy

The Company provides health and personal accident cover for all employees to be discussed and disclosed from time to time.

Annexure– B


  1. Personal Particulars

You shall keep the Company informed of any change in your residential address, your family status, name and address of your legal heir/ nominee or any other relevant particulars.


  1. Nature of Work

You will work at high standards of initiative, creativity, efficiency and economy in the Company. The nature of work and responsibilities will be assigned and explained to you by your senior from time to time.


  1. Working Hours

The regular working hours of the Company are from 9.30 am to 5.30 pm. Work from home if and when applicable will be at management’s discretion based on Company needs and to be pre-approved by the management.


  1. Assignment, Transfer and Deputation

Though you have been engaged to a specific position, the Company reserves the right to send you on deputation/ transfer/ assignment to any of the Company’s branch offices in India or abroad, whether existing at the time of your appointment or to be set up in the future. 


  1. Training

You will hold yourself in readiness for any training at any place whenever and wherever required, to be imparted to you at Company’s expense. Kindly note that refusal to participate in a training programme without any extraneous circumstances would lead to the automatic termination of your employment.



  1. Non-Disclosure/ Confidentiality

You will not during the course of your employment with the Company or at any time thereafter divulge or disclose to any person whomsoever, make any use whatsoever for your own purpose or for any other purpose other than that of the Company, of any information or knowledge obtained by you during your employment as to the business or affairs of the Company including development, process reports and reporting system and you will during the course of your employment hereunder use your best endeavours to prevent any other person from doing so.

1. Restrain


  • Access to Information:

Information is available on a need to the known basis for specific groups and the network file server of the Company is segregated to allow individual sectors information access for projects and units. Access to this is authorized through access privileges approved by unit mentors or project mentors.


  • Restriction on Personal Use:

Use of Company resources for personal use is strictly restricted. This includes and is not limited to usage of computer resources, information, internet service, and working time of the Company for personal use.


  1. Leave 

You will be entitled to leave as laid down in the Standing Orders of the Company and law in force. The Company follows a strict time schedule and latecomers are discouraged unless otherwise notified by you in advance. Late marks will be awarded to you for every late entry and one (1) day of absence counted for every three (3) late marks awarded.


  1. Security

Security is an important aspect of our office infrastructure. Communication security is maintained by controlling physical access to computer systems, disabling all working stations, floppy disk drives and Company-wide awareness about the need for protection of intellectual property and sensitive customer information.


  1. Termination of Service

  • Either party can terminate this employment by serving a notice of one (1) month, provided that the Company may at its option pay salary in lieu of the notice period to terminate employment with immediate effect.


  • In case of Unauthorized absence or absence without permission from duty for a continuous period of seven (7) days, your employment shall automatically come to an end without any notice of termination or notice of payment.


  • You will be governed by the laid down Code of Conduct of the Company and if there is any breach of the same or non-conformance of a contractual obligation or the terms and conditions laid down in this Letter, your service shall be terminated without any notice; notwithstanding any other terms and conditions stipulated herein, the Company reserves the right to invoke other legal remedies as it deems fit to protect its legitimate interest.

Signature of Employee:



Date                             :

1. Standing Orders

You shall abide by the Standing Orders, rules & regulations and service conditions that may be in force or applicable to the Company or are framed from time to time by the Company.





  1. Appointment in Good Faith

It must be specifically understood that this offer is made based on your proficiency in technical/ professional skills you have declared to possess as per your application for employment. In the case at a later stage, any of 

your statements/ particulars furnished are found to be false or misleading or your performance falls short of the minimum standard set by the Company, the Company shall have the right to terminate your services forthwith without giving any notice notwithstanding any other terms and conditions stipulated therein.

Administration Department
              Agnes Jerry
(Asst. Manager, Finance & Admin dept.)

Department Head  
                           Simi Nair
         (Director- Global Operations)

Accounts Department
                Muhammed Suhair
 (Executive-Finance & Admin dept.)
